groupedstats 2.0.1

Extracting p-values for models that don't produce them.

Source: R/grouped_p_value.R
grouped_p_value.Rd

Extracting p-values for models that don't produce them.

grouped_p_value(data, grouping.vars, ..f, ...)

Arguments

data

Dataframe (or tibble) from which variables are to be taken.
grouping.vars

Grouping variables.
..f

A function, or function name as a string.
...

<dynamic> Arguments for .fn.

Author

Indrajeet Patil

Examples

groupedstats:::grouped_p_value(
  data = ggplot2::diamonds,
  formula = scale(price) ~ scale(carat) + (carat | color),
  grouping.vars = c(cut, clarity),
  ..f = lme4::lmer
)

#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular

#>    cut   clarity term           p.value
#>    <ord> <ord>   <chr>            <dbl>
#>  1 Fair  I1      (Intercept)  6.18e-  1
#>  2 Fair  I1      scale(carat) 9.46e- 82
#>  3 Fair  SI2     (Intercept)  7.74e-  1
#>  4 Fair  SI2     scale(carat) 0.       
#>  5 Fair  SI1     (Intercept)  5.91e-  1

#>  8 Fair  VS2     scale(carat) 2.81e- 69
